edu.bath.transitivityutils
Class Navigators

java.lang.Object
  edu.bath.transitivityutils.Navigators

public final class Navigators
extends java.lang.Object

Provides static utility methods for creating and working with Navigator instances.

Method Detail

forMultimap

public static <E> Navigator<E> forMultimap(com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<E,E> multimap)
Creates a Navigator view of the supplied SetMultimap instance. The domain() of the created navigator will be the keySet() of the multimap, whereas the navigator's related(element) invocations will be translated to multimap.get(element) invocations.

The returned navigator will be serializable if the specified multimap is serializable.

Parameters:
multimap - the backing multimap of the returned navigator view

forFunction

public static <E> Navigator<E> forFunction(java.util.Set<E> domain,
                                           com.google.common.base.Function<? super E,? extends java.util.Set<E>> navigationFunction)
Creates a Navigator view of the supplied domain and function. The specified function is used to implement the returned navigator's related(element) invocations. It must return an empty set if applied to an element not in the supplied domain.

The returned navigator will be serializable if the specified set and function are serializable.

Parameters:
domain - the domain of the returned navigator
navigationFunction - the function that will provide the implementation of navigator's related(Object) method

closure

public static <E> java.util.Set<E> closure(Navigator<E> navigator,
                                           E object)
Returns the transitive closure of an object (which always includes the object itself), which is the set of objects that are (by any number of steps) reachable from the specified object, using the supplied navigator.

Parameters:
navigator - the navigator to be used to compute the transitive closure of an element
object - an object (defined in the domain of the navigator)
Returns:
the transitive closure of the element (which includes the element itself)

closureOfMany

public static <E> java.util.Set<E> closureOfMany(Navigator<E> navigator,
                                                 java.lang.Iterable<? extends E> objects)
Returns the unon of the transitive closures of some objects (which always includes the objects themselves), which is the set of objects that are (by any number of steps) reachable from any of the specified objects, using the supplied navigator.

When the transitive closures of the objects are expected to overlap, this method is likely to be more efficient than computing separately the transitive closure of each object and then computing the union of them.

Parameters:
navigator - the navigator to be used to compute the transitive closure of an element
objects - some objects (defined in the domain of the navigator)
Returns:
the transitive closure of the element (which includes the element itself)
